page.title: 10ANNAS GHYLL FARM,LITTLEDALE
page.content: Annas Ghyll was built in 1664,and is the oldest farm in the area.It covers 90 acres and one person works on the farm with the farmer.On a typical working day the farmer gets up at 6:30am to feed cake and barley to the sheep and calves and corn to the hens. Another daily job is to go through the fields to check the cows and sheep.The main source of income for the farm comes from the beef cattle and sheep. There are 60 beef stores and about 115 sheep.He also has a sheepdog,with which he enters annual trials,a cat and some hens.The busiest times of the year are lambing time in spring and haytime.The farm has been in the present family for 44 years.Although it is the oldest farm it is one of the smallest.At first they used horses but now the farmer has tractors,muck spreaders,a combine harvester and a baler.
